name: Dillon Hollis
text:
There was a decent amount of stuff to choose from.
Nothing of which i was looking for.
It doesn’t have that “thrift store smell” otherwise I would have given it a 5 star review instead of a 4.

resp.text: Thank you Dillion. Please check out our two Florence locations next time. They are located at 405 N. Mall Ct, Florence, AL 35630 and 3510 Cloverdale Rd., Florence, AL 35633.

name: Belinda Bowling
text:
Visited store fire the first time 5-21-20 and found it to be a great shopping experience!
Great selection and staff!

name: Andrew McAlister
text: Really good thrift store really good prices will go back again!

name: Robin Featherston
text: I am amazed how clean the items are. Most thrift stores have a funky smell and I end up sneezing. Loaves and Fishes is a nice change.

name: Ann K. Darcy
text: Wonderful as always. It has never not been a pleasurable experience.

name: Tammi Hayes
text: Had changed.. Way to high on their stuff! Use to love it. Not now

name: Zachary Stanfield
text: For a small place they have a pretty good selection

name: Jenn Tittle
text: I have worked at Loaves and Fishes for over 2 years now and I love my job and the customers are amazing.

name: Edth Stearns
text: Really clean. Employees great,very friendly.

name: Stephanie English
text: Nicely organized. Employees are super friendly

name: Caitlin Davis
text: The sweetest most caring people

name: Kelli Lovelace
text: Great thrift store. Very organized.

name: mercymade8
text:
Everything has changed in the Loaves & Fishes stores they look nice but the prices have went up. From what i gather, management has changed.
I used to would shop at several of the locations at least once a week. I would pick up things for others who were in need as well. If it didnt work for them at thrift prices i could afford to buy it & put it back til i found someone who could wear/use it.
Now I can't afford to do that. The last time I went shopping there, I came back with 3 used clothing items which cost me around $15. My mom came over with new clothes she had gotten on sell fot $1 at Walmart. The point of thrifting is being thrifty. JCPenny's & other department stores has new clothes for clearance around these prices.
I enjoy the "treasure seeking" process of going to the thrift store but it is more fun when the treasure wasn't wrestling for a spot in your budget.
I'm not the only one who feels this way. The parking lots used to stay full of customers. Now nit nearly as much traffic goes through there to weed through the donated goods. Thankfully there are more & more options popping up around our area.
I will still go by there sometimes but not my go to spots anymore.

name: Linda Roberts
text: The prices are getting too high for me. Their prices was reasonable but not worth the drive now

name: Keda Johnson
text: Some things are over priced. But overall good store to get used items.

name: Leah Brewer
text: Very well organized shop.

name: Jessica Blevins
text: Clean, kind staff, no trash.

name: Margie Cochran
text: Very friendly and helpful

name: Brandy Dennis
text: Very nice service

name: Wendy “The Southern Gypsy” Schmidlkofer
text: I like the store but all of the loaves and fishes in this area are way over priced for thrift stores.

name: alicia hunter
text: They add so much to the community

name: Michael Smith
text: Thrift store

name: Laura C Patrick
text: The employees are very friendly and helpful with unloading. Great drop off hours and convenient location!

name: Phil Donnelly
text:
One of the best Goodwill donation drop-off places that I've ever been to.  Very friendly staff I definitely will be bringing my donations to this Goodwill station
Thank you very much

name: Miguel Candia
text: So easy to drop and go. Great staff

name: L L
text: Great Place to find treasures.  Thank you for what you do.

name: Terry Reidselth
text: Got good deals

name: Terry Franks
text: I was able to tour the facility and was so impressed with what they are doing to change the lives of young people. Great place to donate your time and money.

name: Phyllis Todd
text: Great place to donate so they can minister to the children in our schools. If not for 1st priority in Decatur Al they might never hear the gospel.

name: Francis Herring
text: We had a great time last night at the Halloween party. Thank you guys for providing so much for our children.

name: Lana Richerzhagen
text: Do not love it.  DO NOT follow ANY safety measures for Covid 19. No masks, distancing, nothing.

name: Ricky Buchanan
text: Very nice, clean and well maintained. The karaoke last night was fun and the service was great, thanks for a good time.

name: Vickie Buchanan
text: My husband and I had a great time last night. Karaoke with Gary Jackson is always fun and the people are very friendly.

name: Elise Dyer
text: I Love it! The people are very friendly. I  became a member. We do alot of Charity work.

name: David Crauswell
text: A great family, and atmosphere. A great place to volunteer, and work for "people helping people ". Charity it begins with you!

name: Clara Hodges
text: Love going here for relaxing Friday and Saturday entertainment

name: fat mama's lunchbox
text: It's a great place to meet people

name: Charles Anderson
text: Oh please, not worth talking about

name: Donna Barnett
text: Wonderful people!!

name: Tammy Crauswell
text: My favorite place,my favorite bar/club.

name: Julie Price
text: Love it!

name: Ginny Winston
text: So thankful for the community to have a donation center so close. Convenient to Liberty park. Kind helpful staff to help unload. Currently open Sundays. Great experience.

name: Don Petry
text: Rapid curbside donation. Everything goes right inside so you don't have to wonder if it's going to be ruined by rain.

name: JERRY SMITH
text:
Wasn't very impressed with the mds that was in stock. But it's hard times now and ppl may not be donating as much as they usually do.
I just did not really care for the whole layout of the store.
And not providing a dressing room is really annoying.

name: valarie mcclellan
text: Efficient.  Good people, doing good work! Thx SA..

name: Curtis Tarver
text: Great place

name: R Loftis
text: We were told they would only take furniture which was fine.  They sent three teenagers who threw my parents possessions in a truck-didn't take all that was supposed to go- didn't speak to me-and left without a word.  I asked them to come back for all that was meant to be donated.  They did not and sped off!  Very disappointing to know your volunteers are in such a hurry to be somewhere else.

name: Sheila Jones
text: I droped off some donations to help someone in need.  Truly God is good and I thank God for just blessing me to be able to bless someone else.🙏🙏🍰

name: Daniel Sisco
text:
S.D. Allen Ministry & Missions is a wonderful organization, that provides local families in need with furniture.

I've been fortunate to have the opportunity to donate various items (used couches, lounge chairs, beds) a few times times to the S.D. Allen Ministry  over the past couple years.  The ministry stores these items (and others) in its warehouse until they find a local family-in-need who could use the furniture.

I have also volunteered on a couple of occasions.  One time, we met at the S.D. Allen building and rode in their moving truck to help them pick up furniture being donated, and then we delivered it to a family who lost their furniture in an electrical fire.  Another time, we delivered beds and bed frames that the S.D. Allen Ministry had purchased to a family of five who had been sleeping on a single mattress on the floor.

Please consider donating any used furniture you are considering throwing out here, I promise it will be put to good use!
